thread.title: Ousted Rome mayor warns of mafia return
thread.title_full: Ousted Rome mayor warns of mafia return | News24

author: news24.com
title: Ousted Rome mayor warns of mafia return
text:
Rome - Rome's mayor cried foul on Friday after being forced to resign over an expenses row and warned the Italian capital could succumb once more to organised crime.
Ignazio Marino, aged 60, stepped down on Thursday over a scandal centred on â‚¬ 20 000 of restaurant bills settled with a city hall credit card over the course of his 28 months in office.
He had already been under intense pressure over the pitiful state of the capital, a failing public transport system and a probe into a criminal group led by a one-eyed mobster that had infiltrated the municipality.
"If the bills hadn't turned up, at some point they would have said I wear socks with holes in them or they would have planted cocaine in my pockets," Marino said in an interview with La Stampa daily.
